I'm not sure is this the right thing you are looking for, but to run JUnit =
Suite class, for JUnit 4 clasess that have annotation style@, you can write=
 as this example in your Test suite() method:

public class AllTests {

   =
 public static Test suite() {
        TestSuite suite =3D new TestSuite("Te=
st for default package");
        // $JUnit-BEGIN$
        
        Test mo=
delTwoTestClass =3D new JUnit4TestAdapter(ModelTwoTest.class);
        Test=
 modelOneTestClass =3D new JUnit4TestAdapter(ModelOneTest.class);

        =
suite.addTest(modelTwoTestClass);
        suite.addTest(modelOneTestClass);=

    
        // $JUnit-END$
        return suite;
    }
}





___________=
_____________________
From: daddytli <thomasyli@...>

ogroups.com

Subject: [junit] Running s=
uites with annotation

  
With "older" traditional creation of test suites,=
 the suite() method is used. I can invoke the test via
Method method =3D cl=
ass1.getMethod( "suite", new Class[0] );
obj1 =3D (Test) method.invoke( nul=
l, new Class[0] );
obj1.run(testresult );

How can I invoke classes which h=
ave the newer annotation style @... (...) defined?

Tom
